net.viktorc.detroid.framework.tuning

Class FENFileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.detroid.framework.tuning.FENFileUtil

  • public final class FENFileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class for generating and filtering FEN files used for static evaluation tuning.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • generateFENFile

        public static void generateFENFile(ControllerEngine engine,
                                   java.lang.String pgnFilePath,
                                   java.lang.String fenFilePath,
                                   int maxNumOfGames)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Generates a file of lines of FEN strings with the results of the games the positions occurred in appended to them. This file can then be used for the optimization of engine parameters.
        Parameters:
        engine - A controller engine that will be responsible for parsing the PGNs and providing FENs for each position.
        pgnFilePath - The path to the file containing the games in PGN.
        fenFilePath - The output file path.
        maxNumOfGames - The maximum number of games that will be parsed and converted into lines of FEN.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the input file does not exist or cannot be read, if the output file path is invalid, or if the engine is not initialized and cannot be initialized.

      • generateFENFile

        public static void generateFENFile(OptimizerEngines[] engines,
                                   int games,
                                   long timePerGame,
                                   long timeIncPerMove,
                                   java.lang.String fenFilePath)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generates a file of lines of FEN strings with the results of the games the positions occurred in appended to them. This file can then be used for the optimization of engine parameters.
        Parameters:
        engines - An array of OptimizerEngines instances that each contain the engines needed for playing games in the Arena. For each non-null element in the array, a new thread will be utilized for the optimization. E.g. if engines is an array of four non-null elements, the games in the fitness function will be distributed and played parallel on four threads. The array's first element cannot be null or a NullPointerException is thrown.
        games - The number of games to play.
        timePerGame - The time each engine will have per game in milliseconds.
        timeIncPerMove - The number of milliseconds with which the remaining time of an engine is incremented after each legal move. be done.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file specified by filePath doesn't exist and cannot be created.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the parameter engines is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If engines doesn't contain at least one non-null element.

      • filterOpeningPositions

        public static void filterOpeningPositions(java.lang.String sourceFenFile,
                                          java.lang.String destinationFenFile,
                                          int numOfPositionsToFilter)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Copies all the lines from the source FEN file to the destination file except for the ones representing positions no more than numOfPositionsToFilter full moves into the game.
        Parameters:
        sourceFenFile - The file path to the source FEN file.
        destinationFenFile - The path to the destination file. If it doesn't exist it will be created.
        numOfPositionsToFilter - The first x full moves to filter from each game.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • filterDraws

        public static void filterDraws(java.lang.String sourceFenFile,
                               java.lang.String destinationFenFile)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Copies all the lines from the source FEN file to the destination file except for the ones representing positions from drawn games.
        Parameters:
        sourceFenFile - The file path to the source FEN file.
        destinationFenFile - The path to the destination file. If it doesn't exist it will be created.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
